Key Arguments: The legislation threatens free speech in Australia.
Terms like 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are open to broad interpretation, making the bill dangerous.
The government previously censored factual information during the Covid-19 pandemic.
The bill contradicts Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which supports freedom of opinion and expression.
The legislation could lead to a form of totalitarianism.
Main Themes: Spiritual and moral opposition to totalitarianism
Notable Quotes: The proposed Bill carries with it the destruction of free speech in Australia should it ever be passed.
The government is seeking to squash Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The more government leans toward totalitarianism the more God will work against it.
